newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Dell, Netscape higher.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Dell, Netscape higher.

text.p: Dell Computer Corp was up more than a point in late trading Tuesday after releasing its quarterly earnings report, one of several high-tech stocks still moving after the bell.
"It's pretty active right now," a trader said of Dell, which was trading at 73-1/4 after closing at 72-1/8. The stock had declined 7/8 of a point during regular trading.
Dell in the late afternoon reported fourth-quarter net income of $1.01 per share, up from $0.35 for the same period the year before.
Also moving up after the bell was Netscape Communications Corp, trading at 32-1/2 after closing at 32-3/8. Intel Corp, however, was trading lower, at 148-3/8 compared to its closing price of 148-7/8.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one volume was 21,900, compared to Monday's 113,500. Session two volume was 14,791,997, while on Monday it was 2,409,400.
